alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 7:25PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pima. * WHEN...Until 930 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 725 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, on the west to southwest side of Tucson. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen with the highest amounts near Starr Pass. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tucson, Drexel Heights, South Tucson, Pascua Pueblo Yaqui Reservation, Valencia West and Tucson Estates. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
